alert.note: Alert for Wabasha (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued April 09 at 9:55AM CDT until further notice by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in La Crosse WI has issued a Flood Watch for the following rivers in Wisconsin...Minnesota... Mississippi River at Wabasha affecting Buffalo and Wabasha Counties. ...FLOOD WATCH FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Mississippi River at Wabasha. * WHEN...From Friday morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 13.5 feet, Water begins to go over highway 60. Flooding also impacts the lower level of Slippery`s restaurant. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 9.9 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached Friday morning. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. Additional river and weather information is available at www.weather.gov/lacrosse. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1000 PM CDT.
